suitability_reason: Artificers excel among races with crafting traditions and mechanical aptitude. Gnomes, Dwarves, and construct races like Warforged naturally gravitate toward this innovative class.

subclasses.alabastria_context: In Alabastria, Alchemists are revered as the bridge between magic and science. They work in the magical academies of Kuriguer, where they study the unique properties of Alabastrian flora and fauna. Their potions are essential for adventurers braving the Otherworldly Wastes, and their research into the mysterious properties of materials found in Kantra has led to breakthrough discoveries. Many serve as court alchemists to the various kingdoms, providing healing potions and magical enhancements for military campaigns.
subclasses.playstyle: Support-focused spellcaster who excels at creating magical items and potions. You'll spend time crafting consumables, providing utility through infusions, and using your alchemical savant abilities to create powerful elixirs. Combat involves area control with spells like Grease and Web, while your experimental elixirs provide versatile buffs to your party.

subclasses.alabastria_context: Armorers in Alabastria are the master craftsmen behind the legendary equipment used by the Huntbound Order and other prestigious guilds. They work in the volcanic forges of Alatman, where they infuse armor with magical properties using the unique metals found in the Maltman mines. Their creations are highly sought after by adventurers exploring the dangerous regions of Kantra, where standard equipment often fails. Many Armorers are former soldiers who turned to crafting after witnessing the limitations of conventional armor in monster encounters.
subclasses.playstyle: Tank-focused martial character with magical armor that can be reconfigured for different situations. You excel at protecting allies through your Guardian armor's defensive field, while your Infiltrator armor makes you a stealthy striker. Your infusions provide magical enhancements to your party's equipment, making you valuable both in and out of combat.

races.name: Warforged
races.continent_reason: living constructs forged in volcanic forges

prominent_continents.reason: mining operations provide raw materials for armor crafting
forge technology and construct creation expertise

subclasses.alabastria_context: Artillerists are the siege masters of Alabastria, developing magical artillery for the various kingdoms' defenses. They work closely with the military forces of Bulsania, where their siege weapons are crucial for defending against the massive creatures that emerge from the frozen wastes. Their innovations in magical artillery have revolutionized warfare, and their creations are used to defend settlements from wyvern attacks and other large threats. Many serve as military advisors, teaching others to use their complex magical weaponry.
subclasses.playstyle: Ranged damage dealer with a magical cannon companion. You excel at area damage and battlefield control through your Eldritch Cannon, which can be configured for different combat situations. Your spells provide additional ranged options, while your infusions enhance your party's ranged capabilities. You're most effective when you can position your cannon strategically and maintain distance from enemies.

subclasses.alabastria_context: Battle Smiths are the elite combat engineers of Alabastria, combining martial prowess with magical invention. They serve as the backbone of many adventuring parties, providing both combat support and magical enhancement. Their Steel Defenders are often modeled after the various creatures they've encountered in their travels, from wyverns to the mysterious beasts of Kantra. Many Battle Smiths are members of the Huntbound Order, where their skills in both combat and magical crafting make them invaluable for dangerous monster hunts.
subclasses.playstyle: Versatile martial character with a magical companion. You can serve as either a frontline fighter or a ranged attacker, with your Steel Defender providing additional battlefield presence. Your infusions make you a valuable support character, while your spellcasting provides utility and combat options. You excel at adapting to different combat situations and supporting your party through both direct action and magical enhancement.

races.name: Warforged
races.subclass_reason: construct expertise and steel defender affinity
races.continent_reason: living constructs forged in volcanic forges

suitability_reason: Barbarians emerge from hardy, tribal cultures that value strength and primal fury. Goliaths, Orcs, and other physically powerful races excel in channeling rage into devastating combat prowess.

subclasses.alabastria_context: Ancestral Guardians in Alabastria are the spiritual protectors of their tribes, channeling the wisdom and power of their ancestors to defend their people. They are particularly revered in the mountain tribes of Bulsania, where the harsh environment has forged strong connections to ancestral spirits. Their abilities to manifest ancestral spirits are seen as divine gifts, and they often serve as spiritual leaders and protectors of their communities. Many have joined the Huntbound Order, where their ancestral wisdom helps guide younger hunters.
subclasses.playstyle: Defensive tank who protects allies by drawing enemy attention and reducing incoming damage. You excel at battlefield control through your Ancestral Protectors, which can hinder enemies and protect allies. Your rage provides damage resistance, while your spiritual abilities offer unique defensive options. You're most effective when you can position yourself between enemies and your allies.

races.name: Goliath
races.subclass_reason: mountain spirit heritage and tribal ancestors

prominent_continents.reason: mountain tribes with strong ancestral traditions
swamp cultures emphasize spiritual guidance from ancestors
wild magic enhances primal beast connections

subclasses.alabastria_context: Beast Barbarians in Alabastria are those who have embraced their primal nature, often through exposure to the wild magic of Kuriguer's forests or the ancient power of Kantra's mysterious creatures. They are seen as both feared and respected, as their transformation abilities suggest a deep connection to the natural world that many find unsettling. Many Beast Barbarians are former rangers or druids who have taken their connection to nature to extreme levels, becoming one with the beasts they once studied.
subclasses.playstyle: Versatile martial character with natural weapons and transformation abilities. You can adapt your combat style through different Bestial Soul features, choosing between claws for multiple attacks, a bite for healing, or a tail for reach and defense. Your rage provides additional damage and resistance, while your transformation abilities offer unique combat options. You excel at close combat and can adapt to different enemy types.

races.name: Dragonborn
races.continent_reason: hardy and militarized, adapted to harsh cold

subclasses.alabastria_context: Berserkers in Alabastria are the embodiment of pure rage and fury, often emerging from the most brutal conflicts and harsh environments. They are particularly common among the militarized societies of Bulsania and the frontier regions of Kamalatman, where survival requires absolute ferocity. Many Berserkers are former soldiers who have been pushed beyond their limits, their minds shattered by the horrors of war or monster encounters. They are both feared and respected for their ability to fight through pain and injury that would stop others.
subclasses.playstyle: High-damage melee fighter who sacrifices defense for offense. You excel at dealing massive damage through your Frenzy ability, though it comes with the cost of exhaustion. Your Intimidating Presence can control the battlefield, while your Retaliation feature ensures you're always dangerous even when attacked. You're most effective in short, intense battles where you can unleash your full fury.

subclasses.alabastria_context: Storm Heralds in Alabastria are those who have been touched by the elemental forces that rage across the world. They are particularly common in the storm-swept coasts of Kuriguer and the frozen wastes of Bulsania, where the elements are at their most powerful. Many are former sailors or mountain guides who have survived encounters with elemental forces, their bodies and spirits forever changed by the experience. They serve as guides and protectors for those who must brave the harshest environments.
subclasses.playstyle: Area control martial character with elemental abilities. You can choose from Desert, Sea, or Tundra environments, each providing different area effects and resistances. Your Storm Aura affects the battlefield around you, while your rage provides additional elemental damage. You excel at controlling enemy movement and providing elemental resistance to your party.

subclasses.alabastria_context: Totem Warriors in Alabastria are the spiritual guardians of their tribes, drawing power from the totemic spirits that watch over their people. They are particularly revered in the tribal cultures of Kamalatman and the mountain clans of Bulsania, where totemic traditions run deep. Each totem represents a different aspect of nature and survival, from the bear's strength to the eagle's vision. Many serve as spiritual leaders and protectors, guiding their people through both physical and spiritual challenges.
subclasses.playstyle: Versatile martial character with totemic abilities that enhance different aspects of combat. You can choose from various totem spirits, each providing different benefits like enhanced damage, mobility, or utility. Your rage provides damage resistance and bonus damage, while your totem abilities offer unique combat options. You excel at adapting to different combat situations and providing utility to your party.

subclasses.alabastria_context: Sorcerers of Wild Magic in Alabastria are the chaotic spellcasters who combine superior arcane magic with wild magic abilities, representing the perfect fusion of chaos and spell. They are particularly common among the chaotic communities and elite guard units, where their wild magic abilities are highly valued. Many serve as chaotic spellcasters and wild magic guardians, using their unique combination of abilities to protect others. Their ability to excel in wild magic and combat has made them invaluable for both chaotic and practical purposes.
subclasses.playstyle: Chaotic spellcaster with superior arcane magic and wild magic abilities. You excel at wild magic through your Wild Magic Surge and Tides of Chaos features, while your Spellcasting provides additional magical options. Your Bend Luck allows you to influence dice rolls, while your arcane magic makes you effective in combat. You're most effective when you can use wild magic and when you can excel in combat through both magical and chaotic means.

subclasses.alabastria_context: Zealots in Alabastria are the divine warriors of their faiths, channeling the power of their gods to smite their enemies. They are particularly common among the religious orders that have emerged since The Bringing, as many races have found new purpose in the divine. They serve as the champions of their faiths, fighting against the forces of darkness and evil that threaten the world. Many are former clerics or paladins who have taken their devotion to extreme levels, becoming living weapons of their gods.

You excel at dealing radiant damage through your Divine Fury, while your Fanatical Focus provides advantage on saving throws. Your Zealot's Divine Strike and Rage Beyond Death make you incredibly difficult to kill, while your Warrior of the Gods feature provides resurrection without material components. You're most effective as a frontline fighter who can survive and return from near-death experiences.

subclasses.alabastria_context: Bards of the College of Creation in Alabastria are the master storytellers and artists who bring the world's stories to life through their performances. They are particularly revered in the cultural centers of Skratonia, where their ability to create temporary objects and creatures through their art is seen as a divine gift. Many serve as court entertainers and historians, preserving the oral traditions of their people through their performances. Their ability to animate objects and create temporary creatures has made them invaluable for both entertainment and practical purposes.

You excel at providing utility through your Performance of Creation, which can create temporary objects and creatures. Your Motif of Creation enhances your party's abilities, while your spellcasting provides additional support options. You're most effective when you can prepare for encounters by creating useful items and when you can support your party through both magical and creative means.

subclasses.alabastria_context: Bards of the College of Eloquence in Alabastria are the master diplomats and negotiators who navigate the complex political landscape of the world. They are particularly valued in the council-led city-states of Skratonia, where their ability to influence others through words is crucial for maintaining peace and order. Many serve as ambassadors and negotiators, representing their people in diplomatic meetings and trade negotiations. Their ability to inspire others and sway opinions has made them invaluable for both political and social purposes.
subclasses.playstyle: Face character with exceptional social abilities and support magic. You excel at social encounters through your Silver Tongue and Unfailing Inspiration features, which make you nearly impossible to fail at persuasion and deception. Your spellcasting provides additional social and support options, while your Bardic Inspiration is more reliable and versatile. You're most effective in social situations and when supporting your party through both magical and social means.

prominent_continents.reason: fey influence creates natural glamour magic

subclasses.alabastria_context: Bards of the College of Glamour in Alabastria are the master enchanters and performers who use their magic to captivate and inspire others. They are particularly common in the entertainment districts of major cities, where their ability to create illusions and charm others is highly valued. Many serve as court entertainers and socialites, using their charm and magic to navigate the complex social hierarchies of their societies. Their ability to inspire others and create temporary alliances has made them invaluable for both entertainment and practical purposes.
subclasses.playstyle: Charm-focused spellcaster with battlefield control and inspiration abilities. You excel at charming enemies and inspiring allies through your Mantle of Inspiration and Enthralling Performance features. Your spellcasting provides additional charm and illusion options, while your Bardic Inspiration offers unique benefits. You're most effective when you can charm enemies or inspire allies, and when you can control the battlefield through both magical and social means.

Many serve as librarians and researchers, preserving and studying the knowledge of their people. Their ability to learn from others and adapt to different situations has made them invaluable for both academic and practical purposes.

You excel at learning spells from other classes through your Magical Secrets feature, while your Cutting Words can hinder enemies and your Additional Magical Secrets provide even more versatility. Your spellcasting provides a wide range of options, while your Bardic Inspiration offers unique benefits. You're most effective when you can adapt to different situations and when you can support your party through both magical and knowledge-based means.

Many serve as bodyguards and entertainers, using their combat skills to protect others while entertaining crowds. The central location and diverse populations of Skratonia make it an ideal place for scholars to gather information and study different tactical approaches.

races.name: Elf
races.continent_reason: Elven longevity and scholarly traditions make them exceptional scholars in Kuriguer's magical academies.
races.subclass_reason: Elven patience and scholarly nature excel in research, study, and developing innovative tactics.

races.name: Human
races.continent_reason: Human curiosity and adaptability make them excellent scholars in Skratonia's diverse and information-rich environment.
races.subclass_reason: Human intelligence and research skills are perfect for studying enemy tactics and developing counter-strategies.

races.name: Gnome
races.continent_reason: Gnome curiosity and magical aptitude make them natural scholars in Kuriguer's magical research institutions.
races.subclass_reason: Gnome intelligence and attention to detail excel in tactical research and strategic analysis.

subclasses.alabastria_context: War Minds in Alabastria often serve as field commanders in the Huntbound Order, leading dangerous missions and inspiring their fellow hunters to greatness.
subclasses.playstyle: Combat-focused strategy and leadership. Perfect for players who want to combine tactical thinking with martial prowess.

prominent_continents.reason: The militarized society and harsh conditions of Bulsania produce natural war minds who excel at leading in combat.
The ongoing conflicts and dangerous terrain of Kamalatman require war minds to lead operations in challenging conditions.

races.name: Dwarf
races.continent_reason: Dwarven military traditions and combat expertise make them natural war minds in Bulsania's militarized society.
races.subclass_reason: Dwarven martial prowess and leadership abilities excel in combat-focused tactics and battlefield command.

races.name: Orc
races.continent_reason: Orcish combat prowess and natural leadership make them excellent war minds in Kamalatman's challenging environment.
races.subclass_reason: Orcish strength and combat experience are perfect for leading from the front lines and inspiring allies.

races.name: Goliath
races.continent_reason: Goliath physical prowess and mountain survival skills make them exceptional war minds in Bulsania's harsh conditions.
races.subclass_reason: Goliath strength and endurance excel in combat leadership and battlefield presence.

races.name: Human
races.continent_reason: Human adaptability and leadership qualities make them excellent war minds in Skratonia's diverse military forces.
races.subclass_reason: Human versatility and tactical thinking are perfect for combat leadership and strategic command.
